messages.content: What is the purpose of ComfyUI_Stable_Makeup?
ComfyUI_Stable_Makeup is a node in ComfyUI that allows users to apply makeup to characters.
From which repository is ComfyUI_Stable_Makeup derived?
ComfyUI_Stable_Makeup is derived from the Stable_Makeup repository by Xiaojiu-z.
How can users try different datasets with ComfyUI_Stable_Makeup?
Users can try different datasets by downloading additional SPIGA models.
What should users do if they encounter missing libraries while using ComfyUI_Stable_Makeup?
Users should open the 'no need requirements.txt' file and install any missing libraries using pip.
Where should the required models for ComfyUI_Stable_Makeup be stored?
The required models should be stored in the ComfyUI/models/stable_makeup folder.
Which CLIP model is used by ComfyUI_Stable_Makeup?
ComfyUI_Stable_Makeup uses the 'openai/clip-vit-large-patch14' CLIP model.
What is the purpose of the SPIGA model in ComfyUI_Stable_Makeup?
The SPIGA model is used for shape-preserving facial landmarks with graph attention networks in ComfyUI_Stable_Makeup.
From which repository is the FaceLib component of ComfyUI_Stable_Makeup derived?
The FaceLib component of ComfyUI_Stable_Makeup is derived from the FaceLib repository by sajjjadayobi.
Where can the benchmark evaluator for ComfyUI_Stable_Makeup be found?
The benchmark evaluator for ComfyUI_Stable_Makeup can be found at ./eval/benchmark/evaluator.py.
What is the purpose of the benchmark evaluator in ComfyUI_Stable_Makeup?
The benchmark evaluator in ComfyUI_Stable_Makeup allows extracting an extended report of metrics for each dataset.
How should the prediction file be structured for benchmark evaluation in ComfyUI_Stable_Makeup?

The prediction file for benchmark evaluation in ComfyUI_Stable_Makeup must follow the same data structure and file extension as the ground truth annotations available in ./data/annotations/<database_name>.
What does each dictionary in the data structure represent in ComfyUI_Stable_Makeup?
In ComfyUI_Stable_Makeup, each dictionary in the data structure represents an image sample.
What information is included in each image sample dictionary in ComfyUI_Stable_Makeup?
Each image sample dictionary in ComfyUI_Stable_Makeup includes the relative image path, bounding box, headpose, landmark database ids, landmarks, and visibilities.
How can the benchmark in ComfyUI_Stable_Makeup be extended for other tasks?

The benchmark in ComfyUI_Stable_Makeup can be extended for other tasks by inheriting the class structure available in ./eval/benchmark/metrics/metrics.py and developing a new task file similar to the available ones for landmarks and headpose.
What are the available task files for extending the benchmark in ComfyUI_Stable_Makeup?
The available task files for extending the benchmark in ComfyUI_Stable_Makeup are landmarks and headpose.
